result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Katelin J. Fier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 3:37 p.m. Defendant Katelin J. Fier in court with attorney Bryce Schoenborn.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss DPA - granted. Adj. 3:40 p.m.

03:19 pm - Defendant Katelin J. Fier in court with attorney Bryce Schoenborn.  Defendant Katelin J. Fier in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Count 1 - DPA.  Count 2 - Probation Revoked.  Schoenborn in receipt of Revocation Summary and further states State will not be rescinding the DPA on Count 1 at this time.  Michlig/Schoenborn/Court statement to sentencing.  
Court Sentence
Jail 86 days - Jail credit 86 days 
Appeal rights given - Adjourned 03:36 pm

01:46 pm - Defendant Katelin J. Fier in court with attorney Patrick Howard Finlan.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14tr2037, 14cf131, 14cf139 and 14cf194.  State moves to dismiss 14tr2037, 14cf139 and 14cf194 - Granted.  State moves to amend Count 1 in 14cf131 to 961.41(3g)(am) a Class I Felony - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to both counts in 14cf131.  Plea questionnaire and DPA for count 1 filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty of count 2 and defers judgment in Count 1 and accepts the DPA.  Schiek/Finlan/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing.
Court Sentence - Count 2
WHS/POP 12 months
Court Costs/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
AODA assessment and recovery
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Special Disposition under 973.015 if successfully completes probation and pays all costs
Appeal rights given
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

02:38 pm - Defendant Katelin J. Fier in court with attorney Patrick Howard Finlan.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf131 and 14cf139.  Finlan files Waiver of Preliminary Hearing forms with court.    Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  State files Information. State to provide Finlan with copies of Information - both cases - waives reading and enters not guilty pleas.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

03:44 pm - Defendant Katelin J. Fier in court with attorney Patrick Howard Finlan.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Noel Lawrence, under the student practice rule.  Calling 14tr2037, 14cf131 and 14cf139.    In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived.  Finlan/Lawrence motion to modify $1,000 cash bond in case 14cf139.  Court denies motion.  Prelims on both cases.  Bail continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 10, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

02:10 pm - Defendant Katelin J. Fier in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Noel Lawrence, under the student practice rule.  Calling 14cf139 and 14cf131.  Hogan for Bloom.  Court questions defendant as to obtaining counsel.  Defendant states contacted PD today.  Defendant requests no contact provision of bond be lifted.  Court will not amend bond.  Bail continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
defendant appear in br I on new felony case and given cash bond - this case put to AIA with other case
from JA denying PFAC - pfac attached
No contact WHATSOEVER with co defendants Corey Harms or Deangelo Jones - May not leave Oneida County w/o prior court approval

Defendant Katelin J. Fier in court, in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:16
In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - will seek PD/Counsel - 
Schiek to bail - Court sets $ sig bond -  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 8, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
